extendedInfo.description: WiFi Shoot it is the first app in the Google Play to use the WiFi Direct technology to wirelessly transmit photos, videos and any file directly between two Android devices!If you're having any problems email me your device model and what you tried to do to make it work that I'll reply as fast as possible.------------Full/paid version advantages:- transfer of any file type- transfer files of any size- transfer of multiple files at once- several speed optimisations that reaches up to 3x transfer speed (compared to free version)------------What others been saying:"This works so much faster than Bluetooth", "WiFi Shoot is free, and Iâm impressed with what it can already do" (Tested www.tested.com/news/166998-google-app-play-0813/ )"Itâs easy, itâs effective, and for a beta version, it works pretty darn well." (iJailbreak www.ijailbreak.com/applications/wifi-shoot-android-app-download/ )"it's remarkably easy to use" (androidpolice.com http://www.androidpolice.com/2012/08/06/wi-fi-shoot-beta-lets-users-share-photos-and-videos-via-wi-fi-direct/ )"(WiFi Shoot) do a pretty impressive job" (redmondpie.com http://www.redmondpie.com/wifi-shoot-for-android-lets-your-transfer-videos-and-photos-between-devices-using-wi-fi-direct-video/ )------------This app was personally successfully tested on the following devices:Galaxy Nexus (GSM), Nexus 7, Galaxy S2 (International), Galaxy S3 International (both on Ice Cream Sandwich and Jelly Bean), HTC One S, Nexus 10, Nexus 4 (on 4.2.2), Sony Zperia ZNote to ASUS Transformer TF300 users: ASUS removed WiFi Direct from the TF300 on Jelly Bean. The app needs WiFi Direct to work. That's ASUS fault!Note to Samsung Galaxy SIII users: The Galaxy SIII does not behave well to receive invitations. Try to always initiate the connection from the Galaxy SIII.This app have been reported by users to be working perfectly on the following devices:Galaxy S, HTC One VI'll be personally testing more soon.------------Compatibility notice:This app theoretically works with any pair of ICS+ devices with WiFi Direct support. But unfortunately, due to bad implementation of the WiFi Direct drivers by individual device manufacturers sometime devices are not compatible with each other, don't work multiples times until a reboot, or simply decide not to work at all. For example, the Galaxy Nexus on ICS used to crash and reboot the device just by turn on and off the wifi direct a few times, and that have nothing to do with the WiFi Shoot, it was just on the device settings menu. Unfortunately there's really nothing that WiFi Shoot can do to work around those specific devices issues. I strongly suggest users having those kind of problems to send angry e-mails to your specific device manufacturer customer support.If it does not work on your device, DO NOT BUY THE PREMIUM, it won't change anything!Graphic Design by: Sophia Coelhohttp://sophiacoelho.com.br/* Please, if you have any force close during usage, report it and tell me on the report which devices you're using. Thank!tags:"wifi direct" "ad hoc" "file transfer" shoot wireless files images videos share

reviews.title: Wow! Very impressive
reviews.comment: A must have for supported phone users with tablets ... Especially if you take a lot of photos and videos. Nice job! For a sixth star, NFC pairing for devices would be great.
reviews.author: Christopher Dyanand

reviews.title: Cruddy on Nexus 7
reviews.comment: It was spotty and hardly ever worked (connected) from my GS2 Skyrocket to my nexus 7. When it would connect, fantastic and super fast. But it\'d bug out more consistently then working correctly.
reviews.author: Phil Turner

reviews.title: Prblm facin wid HTC desire x
reviews.comment: Hi m using HTC desire x .when I m tryin to send image or video files  it says upgrade it to premium version .I love to use this app..so can you please how to fix it ?.shall I go for upgrade version.Ty.awaiting for ur rly .
reviews.author: jigar janani

reviews.title: Average app
reviews.comment: Felt this app can do better, using in my note 2 with my nexus 10. Hopefully future can improve the connection speed. Recommended for beginner.
reviews.author: Joe Chai

reviews.title: Does not work with HTC one x.
reviews.comment: The app fails to connect. I tried sending a file and it keeps falling.
reviews.author: Kausar Khan

reviews.title: Solid, but missing features
reviews.comment: It works well enough, but there is no UI. It would get 5 stars if it displayed transfer status (in the app itself) the along with real time transfer speed info, like MBps and time remaining for transfer. Other than that, it\'s quite good. NFC pairing for connections wouldn\'t hurt either.
reviews.author: Lee Tracte

reviews.title: Hopeless
reviews.comment: Worked intermittently until I wanted to send multiple files at which time I was prompted to pay to upgrade which I did. Now neither device can even see each other let alone transfer files. Galaxy SIII and Nexus 7. Avoid paying to upgrade - this does NOT work. Repeat, does NOT work. Do not believe these notes from the developer!
reviews.author: Bill Obonge

reviews.title: Worst app!!!!!!!!\"!!!
reviews.comment: It worked OK by the trial version  i upgraded to the full version  and its lagging, not connecting, crashing. This is the worst application on the play store  . don\'t cheat the users. I lost my money
reviews.author: arshaq kasim

reviews.title: Free version is a hoax!!!!
reviews.comment: Absolutely horrible app.  Want to try out \"send file\" from a Nexus 4 to a Nexus 10 with the free version.  Open gallery, open album, open pic, press the Wifi Shoot! icon.   It asks \"whether you want to upgrade to the premium version\"?  Press cancel, operation is cancelled.  Press OK, I am forced to buy.  So do you want to offer the free version or not?
reviews.author: Edward Lor

reviews.title: Best app ever
reviews.comment: Just got a new phone and I needed to switch stuff over from my tablet. Paid the buck right away to upgrade and shot all my media and other files.  And it\'s fast! Took me a lot of play store searching, googling and uninstalling of failed apps before I found this gem!
reviews.author: Anh Tran

reviews.title: so good
reviews.comment: very perfect
reviews.author: zamri zamzamri

reviews.title: Poor
reviews.comment: I\'ve managed to make it work once and thats it. It\'s so bugged. HTC one xl 2 one xl.
reviews.author: justin leech

reviews.title: Nexus 7
reviews.comment: Cool worked nicely any file size limitation?
reviews.author: Sukant Saha

reviews.title: Didn\'t even give a single free transfer before begging for money
reviews.comment: Greedy developer. I\'m not paying for an app before I even know it works, and none of my videos are under the pathetic 150MB transfer limit. Uninstalled.
reviews.author: Michael T.

reviews.title: Works perfectly on Galaxy S2 and Nexus 7
reviews.comment: Make sure you follow the instructions, it definitely works :)
reviews.author: Alex Moulsley

reviews.title: Htc one v
reviews.comment: Good app works fine on one v but should limit for transfer video files are very small.should increase limit to 201mb.

reviews.title: Loved it!!
reviews.comment: Thanks a ton to the developer.

reviews.comment: Funciona muy bien entre un galaxy nexus y un nexus 4.

reviews.title: Works with N4 and N7
reviews.comment: Eventually got it to work with N4 & N7, in both directions. After first connecting them in the wifi direct menu and the N4 showing in the Remembered Groups, before using the app
